body_html: @AaronYKing I guess certain companies might have their own working versions of XNOR-Net but, as far as I know, there is no complete public implementation so far. It's too bad that the original authors didn't release their code for XNOR-Net for the sake for reproducibility. If I remember correctly, the authors of DoReFa-Net tried to reproduce results of the original paper but failed to obtain comparable results. As the description in the paper is a bit thin at times, it might take a while for a really comparable, complete implementation of XNOR to be released (no matter if TensorFlow or Caffe).

body: @AaronYKing I guess certain companies might have their own working versions of XNOR-Net but, as far as I know, there is no complete public implementation so far. It's too bad that the original authors didn't release their code for XNOR-Net for the sake for reproducibility. If I remember correctly, the authors of DoReFa-Net tried to reproduce results of the original paper but failed to obtain comparable results. As the description in the paper is a bit thin at times, it might take a while for a really comparable, complete implementation of XNOR to be released (no matter if TensorFlow or Caffe).
